longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 
 - Passports issued to nationals of Reunion must be valid on
   arrival. 
 - Nationals of France are allowed to enter with expired
   National ID Cards (max. 5 years) issued between 1 January
   2004 and 31 December 2013, provided holder was 18 years of
   age or older on the date of issue.
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card issued to nationals of France.
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for Nationals of Reunion. 
Minors:
- Children up to/incl.16 years of age
  
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Reunion will be expected to
  hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
- A separate visa is required for children up to/incl. 16
  years of age if  
Additional Information:
- Visitors holding passports containing a British inadmissible
  stamp could be refused entry.
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay. 
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry.
